Interface ec.id.ReachableID

Implementing Classes:
ECID
public abstract interface ReachableID
extends ID
Interface defining basic 'resolveTo' method. This interface defines the 'resolveTo' method, which is a primitive interface for taking an identity (an instance of a class that implements this interface) and turning it into some a fragile, active local reference to the object identified by the identity.

Author:
Scott B. Lewis, slewis@communities.com

Method Summary
Object resolveTo()
          Classes that implement this interface are implicitly agreeing to provide the following method for creating new 'proxy' instances of objects as a result of calling the following method.
 

Method Detail

resolveTo

public Object resolveTo()
                          throws Exception
Classes that implement this interface are implicitly agreeing to provide the following method for creating new 'proxy' instances of objects as a result of calling the following method. That is, identity instances are basically 'dead' unique references to some remote object (they don't imply any connectivity). Any classes implementing this method are contractually agreeing to all clients to turn that 'dead' reference into a 'live' reference (i.e. a proxy), so that further real time interaction is possible.

Underneath this resolveTo operation is some mechanism (EC comm system) to turn a 'dead' reference (what the identity bits are) into a locally 'live' reference (the Object return value from this method).

Returns:
Object that is new 'live' reference to an object identified by the instance of the class that implements this method
Throws:
Exception - thrown if any one of a number of problems occur
